data.title: How To Qualify for the 2024 Ultimate Long Drive World Championship
data.text:
Who Can Play?

Anyone may compete in the 2024 Ultimate Long Drive World Championship Series. There are divisions for all ages and abilities…from ages 7 and Under to 75+. All adult categories include both, amateur and professional divisions.

Amateur / Professional / USGA Considerations

in January 2022 the USGA removed the sport of long drive from its purview. Read more HERE. Anyone can play the sport of long drive for money without affecting USGA amateur status. The USGA does not recognize professionals in long drive as a disqualification for amateur status in USGA events.

ULD allows players to play either or both (for points or for money) during the season. Players may qualify for the 2024 ULD World Championship on points or money earned…or both.

Here’s a step-by-step explanation of how to get involved in the sport of long drive and to qualify to play in the 2024 ULD World Championship.

Membership

An active ULD Membership ID is required to participate in the ULD World Championship. Membership IDs are activated annually HERE.

USA

USA League Play: ULD operates sanctioned leagues across the USA. Each league will play a minimum of six events each season with a League Championship at the end. Ending the season as the winner (points or money) in a division will qualify that player for the 2024 ULD World Championship. Winning the League Championship in any division will qualify that player for the 2024 ULD World Championship.

North American Tour: Winning any division in any of the events in the 2024 North American Tour will qualify that player for the 2024 ULD World Championship.

Overall points and/or money winners (for the season) in each category will qualify for the 2024 ULD World Championship. Points and money calculations are combined from all eligible (sanctioned) events to determine the overall winners.

International

ULD sanctions events and/or series internationally to qualify players In their respective countries for the 2024 ULD World Championship.

Training

ULD operates ULD Academy with clinics and individual training opportunities at various locations. ULD Academy Speed Training includes three levels of training: Stage 1; Stage 2; and Stage 3. Read more HERE.

Equipment

ULD does not require a player to have a specific type of equipment to participate. A maximum sole to grip tip length (as measured on a Mitchell ClubLength Ruler) of 48″ is allowed. It is quite normal (and recommended) for newcomers in the sport to use their regular play driver in competition. Once a player is committed to the sport, it is recommended to seek out a reputable and knowledgeable club supplier who specializes in our sport. Read more HERE.

The 2024 ULD World Championship will be held in October at Par Tee Golf Center in West Columbia, SC. Read more HERE.
